content: रतिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [रम्-क्तिन्] {@--1@} Pleasure, delight, satisfaction, joy; <ls>Ś. 2. 1.</ls> {@--2@} Fondness for, devotion or attachment to, pleasure in (with <ab>loc.</ab>); पापे रतिं मा कृथाः <ls>Bh. 2. 77</ls>; स्वयोषिति रतिः <ls n="Bh.">2. 62</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 23</ls>; <ls>Ku. 5. 65.</ls> {@--3@} Love, affection; <ls>S. D.</ls> thus defines it: --रतिर्मनोनुकूलेऽर्थे मनसः प्रवणायितं <ls n="S. D.">207</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="S. D.">206</ls> also; (it is the Sthāyibhāva of the {%rasa%} called शृंगार <ab>q. v.</ab>). {@--4@} Sexual pleasure; दाक्षिण्योदकवाहिनी विगलिता याता स्वदेशं रतिः <ls>Mk. 8. 38</ls>; so रतिसर्वस्वं <ab>q. v.</ab> below. {@--5@} Sexual union, coition, copulation. {@--6@} The goddess of love, the wife of Kāma or Cupid; साक्षात्कामं नवमिव रतिर्मालती माधवं यत् <ls>Māl. 1. 15</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 23</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">4. 45</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 2.</ls> {@--7@} The pudenda. {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of the sixth digit (कला) of the moon. {@--9@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Rest, cessation.
